item.title: Creating a Debian virtual machine with Qemu on macOS
item.description: I have to admit, I haven’t used VMs a lot in the last 5+ years or at least not directly. I’ve been using Docker for a long time and my limited exposure to VMs were through Vagrant at my old job. The reason I dug up how to run a Debian VM using Qemu is simple: I needed a Debian VM and VirtualBox is just too damn heavy. I only needed a lightweight Debian installation to play around with eBPF and Go.
